page.title: 04History
page.content: Middle Barton is a village between the hamlets of Steeple Barton and Westcote Barton. It began to develop in 1350 when the thriving community at Steeple Barton came to an end because of the Black Death. Middle Barton became an 'open' village with many small holders. The building of Heyford Bridge made the east-west road important because people could travel out of the village. In the 1860's and 1870's,Middle Barton took its present shape with people acting as squatters and building their cottages on the roadside waste.
